channel.title: How Do I Change the Way Items Look?
channel.description: Hi everyone, I posted this because I want to know how to change the way items look in your inventory.

item.title: How Do I Change the Way Items Look?
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Docent:

I am using a 317 client. All I want to do is change the way logs, buckets, platebodies, and runes look to make them look like how they did in revision 289 and before

O.K. thank you very much for being direct and providing enough information.

I can explain it easier if you add my Skype: team_rocket_dev

If you don’t want to learn about a solution to your problem chatting via Skype, below is some helpful information:

  • In your Client files, do you know what the class containing your Item Definitions is named as? It will probably look something like: “Class 9”, “ItemDef”, “ItemDefinitions”, etc. I don’t recommend this, but you can hard-code yourself a new Inventory Model.

  • Do you know of, or use Tom’s Cache Suite? It’s a popular Cache Editing program.

  • I’m not sure if Jagex just overlapped existing models in the Clients after 289, but you could try sticking your nose into that revision and see what you can find. There are programs that can grab the models, which you can then view.

  • There are also multiple versions of the same logs (at least in these Clients). You could try using one of those as well.

EDIT: Or you can always use Go-Ogle and see if you can find the models in a thread with a download link and pack them.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I Change the Way Items Look?

item.title: How Do I Change the Way Items Look?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Teem_Rocket, post:2, topic:525646”]You’ll need to modify the Inventory Models your Client uses.

Note:

  1. Please post which Client revision you’re using.
  2. Use the Go-Ogle machine.
  3. There are tutorials on how to do things like this EVERYWHERE.
  4. You can always just change the I.D. of the Inventory Model to another existing item. (|-|3@9|-|@><[/quote]

I am using a 317 client. All I want to do is change the way logs, buckets, platebodies, and runes look to make them look like how they did in revision 289 and before

Read full topic

item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

You’ll need to modify the Inventory Models your Client uses.

Note:

  1. Please post which Client revision you’re using.
  2. Use the Go-Ogle machine.
  3. There are tutorials on how to do things like this EVERYWHERE.
  4. You can always just change the I.D. of the Inventory Model to another existing item. (|-|3@9|-|@><
